name: GravityForms File Upload for GAE
author: Aucor

sections.description: The Gravity Forms GAE File Upload is a simple plugin that makes use of various GravityForms and WordPress hooks to adjust form submission parameters and WordPress upload paths to make Gravity Forms file uploading work with Google App Engine and Google Cloud Storage.
sections.installation:
1. Upload gravityforms-gae-file-upload -directory to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
sections.faq:
Do I need to configure the plugin in any way?

No. The plugin doesn’t have any configurable features. Just activate it and all your future Gravity Forms file uploads should go directly to Google Cloud Storage.

Where can I learn more about running WordPress on Google App Engine?

We are collecting an unofficial information resource about running WordPress on Google App Engine, you can find it at http://aucor.github.io/wordpress-on-gae/

short_description: The Gravity Forms GAE File Upload allows you to use Gravity Forms' file uploading features with Google App Engine.
description: The Gravity Forms GAE File Upload is a simple plugin that makes use of various GravityForms and WordPress hooks to adjust form submission parameters and WordPress upload paths to make Gravity Forms file uploading work with Google App Engine and Google Cloud Storage.

upgrade_notice.1.0: 1.0 is the first release of Gravity Forms GAE File Upload -plugin
